name: Basilica of the National Vow
address: Carchi N122 and Venezuela Street, Historic Center, Quito
description: One of the largest neo-Gothic churches in Latin America, famous for its gargoyles inspired by Ecuador's native animals and for offering panoramic views of the city.

name: Middle of the World
address: Av. Manuel Córdova Galarza Km. 13.5, Quito
description: An emblematic monument marking the equatorial line, where you can stand with one foot in each hemisphere. It includes museums, shops, and interactive scientific demonstrations.

name: Quito Cable Car (Teleférico)
description: A cable car that ascends the Pichincha Volcano, offering breathtaking views of Quito and access to scenic hiking trails ideal for nature lovers and photographers.

name: Plaza Grande
address: Venezuela and García Moreno Streets, Historic Center, Quito
description: The political and social heart of Quito, surrounded by the Carondelet Palace, the Metropolitan Cathedral, and other historic colonial landmarks.

name: La Ronda Street
address: Morales Street (La Ronda), Historic Center, Quito
description: One of the city’s most traditional streets, filled with artisan workshops, coffee shops, and live music, reflecting the bohemian spirit of colonial Quito.

name: La Carolina Park
description: A large urban park featuring lagoons, jogging tracks, sports courts, the Botanical Garden, and recreational spaces for families and athletes.

name: City Museum
address: García Moreno S1-47 and Rocafuerte Streets, Quito
description: Located in a former colonial hospital, this museum narrates Quito’s history from its founding to the present day through interactive and educational exhibits.

name: El Panecillo Hill
address: Top of El Panecillo Hill, Quito
description: A natural lookout crowned by the statue of the Virgin of Quito, offering the best panoramic views of the historic center and the entire city.
